def.dt: :a male child It's a boy! She gave birth to a baby boy this morning. a nine-year-old boy named David Okay, boys and girls, it's time to play a game. Ever since I was a (little/young) boy, I've wanted to fly airplanes.
:son Is this your little boy? He's our oldest/youngest boy. That's my boy! Good job, Son.

:a young man a group of teenage boys My parents want me to meet a nice boy and get married. Don't be so hard on him. He's just a boy. He's a boy genius. a boy wonder [=a young man who has achieved many great things]

:a usually young man from a specified kind of place city/country boys = boys from the city/country a local/hometown boy a poor boy from the north a farm boy [=a young man who lives and works on a farm]
:the male friends or work partners of a man viewed as a group Wait till the boys back home hear about this! Our boss thinks of himself as just one of the boys. He went out drinking with the boys.
:a man of any age The phrases my dear boy and old boy are used as friendly ways for one man to address another man. Why, my dear boy, of course I want to see you. Cheer up, old boy. see also old boy

:a man or boy who does a particular job a messenger boy Boy is often offensive in this sense when the person being described is an adult. see also altar boy ball boy batboy bellboy busboy delivery boy paperboy

dt.snote: The expression boys will be boys is used to say that it is not surprising or unusual when men or boys behave in energetic, rough, or improper ways. You shouldn't be too hard on them for staying out so late. Boys will be boys.

dro.dre: separate the men from the boys

entry.dxnl: see also bad boy big boys good old boy poster boy pretty boy

utxt.un: often used before another noun his boyhood home [=where he lived when he was a boy] boyhood heroes/friends

utxt.vi: He has a boyish charm about him.
She's always had a boyish figure.

dt.un: used as a way to express surprise or enthusiasm Boy, I sure am hungry! Boy, have I got a story for you! There's a surprise? Oh, boy! What is it? Boy, oh, boy. This is great!! Boy, that test was really hard.

def.dt: :a member of an organization for boys ages 11 to 17 Boy Scouts participate in group activities, learn skills, and are encouraged to have good morals and be good citizens. called also Scout compare cub scout girl scout
:a boy who helps the priest during a Catholic service
:a man who says or does things that shock other people
:a young and successful man who does things in a way that is very different from the usual way He has become known as the bad boy of the American television industry.
:a boy who picks up balls that go out of play during a game in tennis, baseball, etc.
:a boy or young man who delivers goods to customers from a store or restaurant

:a person whose job is to run errands for important people He worked his way up from errand boy to regional sales manager. Errand boy is often used figuratively to criticize people by suggesting that they are controlled by someone more powerful. The governor is nothing more than an errand boy for the big companies in his state.
:a white man from the southern U.S. who has interests, beliefs, etc., that are commonly associated with white southern men
:an older male student in a British school who is chosen to have special duties and to represent the school
